alert.note: Alert for Alleghany; Ashe (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 28 at 4:52PM EDT until August 28 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Blacksburg has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Alleghany NC County in northwestern North Carolina... Ashe County in northwestern North Carolina... Central Grayson County in southwestern Virginia... * Until 1100 PM EDT Monday. * At 452 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain within the warned area. Flooding has been reported by local law enforcement in the Baldwin and Todd areas with at least one road completely flooded and closed in both directions. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen within this area during the past 1 to 1 1.2 hours and additional heavy rainfall is tracking into this same area from the south. Very heavy rain also extends northward into central Grayson county. The ground in these areas is completely saturated from recent heavy rainfall. Additional rainfall will significantly increase the flooding threat. Flooding and flash flooding is already ongoing or imminent. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Jefferson... West Jefferson... Lansing... Mouth Of Wilson... Laurel Springs... Glendale Springs... Sugar Grove... This includes the following streams and drainages... Bear Branch, Crab Fork, Big Horse Creek, Bridle Creek, Dog Creek, Dry Run, Call Creek, Elk Creek, Comers Rock Branch, Darnell Creek, Dickey Creek, Farmers Branch, Flag Pond Branch, Fox Creek and Beaver Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Precautions/Preparedness Statements: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
